trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Benefitsolver | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Benefitsolver | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Benefitsolver with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Benefitsolver with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Benefitsolver.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Benefitsolver.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Benefitsolver single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Benefitsolver single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Benefitsolver will be able to single sign into the application using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Benefitsolver will be able to single sign into the application using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Benefitsolver
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Benefitsolver

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Benefitsolver.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Benefitsolver.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Benefitsolver.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Benefitsolver.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Benefitsolver, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Benefitsolver, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Benefitssolver</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Benefitssolver</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Benefitsolver with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Benefitsolver with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Your Benefitsolver application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration.
trans-unit.target: Your Benefitsolver application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows an example for this.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows an example for this.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Benefitsolver application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Benefitsolver application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Benefitsolver page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Benefitsolver page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App Settings page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App Settings page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your Benefitsolver application (e.g.: “http://azure-dev.benefitsolver.com
trans-unit.target: In the Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your Benefitsolver application (e.g.: “http://azure-dev.benefitsolver.com

trans-unit.source: In the Reply URL textbox, type your Benefitsolver AssertionConsumerService URL (e.g.: “https://dev.benefitsolver.com/benefits/BenefitSolverView?page\_name=single\_signon\_saml”).
trans-unit.target: In the Reply URL textbox, type your Benefitsolver AssertionConsumerService URL (e.g.: “https://dev.benefitsolver.com/benefits/BenefitSolverView?page\_name=single\_signon\_saml”).

trans-unit.source: You can get the actual value for your environment from your Benefitsolver support team.
trans-unit.target: You can get the actual value for your environment from your Benefitsolver support team.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Benefitsolver page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Benefitsolver page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Send the downloaded metadata file to your Benefitsolver support team.
trans-unit.target: Send the downloaded metadata file to your Benefitsolver support team.

trans-unit.source: Your Benefitsolver support team has to do the actual SSO configuration.
trans-unit.target: Your Benefitsolver support team has to do the actual SSO configuration.

trans-unit.source: You will get a notification when SSO has been enabled for your subscription.
trans-unit.target: You will get a notification when SSO has been enabled for your subscription.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: |Attribute Name|Attribute Value| |---|---| |ClientID|You need to get this value from your Benefitsolver support team.| |ClientKey|You need to get this value from your Benefitsolver support team.| |LogoutURL|You need to get this value from your Benefitsolver support team.| |EmployeeID|You need to get this value from your Benefitsolver support team.|
trans-unit.target: |Attribute Name|Attribute Value| |---|---| |ClientID|You need to get this value from your Benefitsolver support team.| |ClientKey|You need to get this value from your Benefitsolver support team.| |LogoutURL|You need to get this value from your Benefitsolver support team.| |EmployeeID|You need to get this value from your Benefitsolver support team.|

trans-unit.source: For each data row in the table above, click add user attribute.
trans-unit.target: For each data row in the table above, click add user attribute.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute Name textbox, type the attribute name shown for that row.
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute Name textbox, type the attribute name shown for that row.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute Value textbox, select the attribute value shown for that row.
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute Value textbox, select the attribute value shown for that row.

trans-unit.source: Click Complete.
trans-unit.target: Click Complete.

trans-unit.source: Click Apply Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Apply Changes.

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Benefitsolver, they must be provisioned into Benefitsolver.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Benefitsolver, they must be provisioned into Benefitsolver.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Benefitsolver, users have to be manually created by the Benefitsolver support team.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Benefitsolver, users have to be manually created by the Benefitsolver support team.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Benefitsolver user account creation tools or APIs provided by Benefitsolver to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Benefitsolver user account creation tools or APIs provided by Benefitsolver to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Benefitsolver **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Benefitsolver **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
